page.title: 12THE RIG
page.content: The rig is used each year on the afternoon of the Common riding as a horse racing course. Many of the horses which have taken part in the event of the morning are given an opportunity to show their speed in the afternoon. The local people walk or drive up to the Rig having been up since before the sound of the first drum at six in the morning. This year (1985) it had been hoped to have a second race meeting but after one of the wettest summers in living memory the course had become too soft to allow racing to take place. The race course is a point to point course and therefore is not very long.
